TextBlock.Text: <color=lightblue>Enji</color>: I finally have the opportunity to be on my own. I've been planning to do this for a while now, I just needed to wait for the right conditions.
Ever since my younger days when no one appreciated my dreams of space trains being the next big thing for Nomai-kind, I've been planning to get away from my clan to build it all myself.
I knew it could be done. I simply needed planets that were small enough with at least one of them containing <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> for use as an energy source.
After identifying this particular system for meeting my specifications, I quietly hijacked one of the escape pods from my <color=orange>vessel</color> and managed to leave undetected.

To prevent my clan from finding and stopping me before I finish construction, I've set up this <color=orange>One-Way Signal Blocker</color>. It will make it harder for them to track me down and it'll still let me get back to them once I finish the train's warp functionality.
But it won't stop them from looking for me. I've covered my tracks as best I could and cleared the crash site. Two uninterrupted weeks is all I ask.
Every time I ever brought up the fact that "I like trains" the others would groan like they'd heard it a thousand times before! (...I suppose they have. From me.)

...But no one wanted to assist me, or at the very least supervise me! They'd come up with excuses like "It'd be dangerous to experiment with Ghost Matter" or "What about preserving the planets for potential future species?" There's no way we've made so many technical advancements without incurring some amount of risk.
Please let this buy me enough time.
